import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import os

# Data provided
data = [
    {'genre': 'religious art', 'count': 54},
    {'genre': 'portrait', 'count': 16},
    {'genre': 'history painting', 'count': 10},
    {'genre': 'nude', 'count': 8},
    {'genre': 'mythological painting', 'count': 4},
    {'genre': 'figure painting', 'count': 3},
    {'genre': 'allegory', 'count': 3},
    {'genre': 'interior view', 'count': 1},
    {'genre': 'genre art', 'count': 1},
    {'genre': 'Hodegetria', 'count': 1}
]

# Extract genres and counts
genres = [item['genre'] for item in data]
counts = [item['count'] for item in data]

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))

# Create horizontal bar chart
bars = ax.barh(genres, counts, color='steelblue', edgecolor='navy', alpha=0.7)

# Add value labels on the bars
for i, (bar, count) in enumerate(zip(bars, counts)):
    ax.text(count + 0.5, i, str(count), va='center', fontsize=10)

# Customize the plot
ax.set_xlabel('Number of Paintings', fontsize=12, fontweight='bold')
ax.set_ylabel('Genre', fontsize=12, fontweight='bold')
ax.set_title('Count of Paintings by Genre', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
ax.grid(axis='x', alpha=0.3, linestyle='--')

# Invert y-axis to show highest count at the top
ax.invert_yaxis()

# Adjust layout to prevent label cutoff
plt.tight_layout()

# Create directory if it doesn't exist and save the plot
save_dir = '/home/bleon/git/XMODE/ArtWork/experiments/log-batch/anthropic-claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929/20251208-174301-r001'
os.makedirs(save_dir, exist_ok=True)
save_path = os.path.join(save_dir, 'paintings_by_genre_count.png')
plt.savefig(save_path, dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')

print(f"Plot successfully saved to: {save_path}")
plt.close()
